findings.title: Global verbosity options not documented
findings.description: The parent 'jira-as' command supports '--verbose/-v' and '--quiet/-q' global options, but these are not documented in the 'Global Options' section of SKILL.md
findings.actual_cli:
jira-as [OPTIONS] COMMAND
Options:
  --version
  -o, --output [text|json|table]
  -v, --verbose                   Enable verbose output
  -q, --quiet                     Suppress non-essential output
  --help
findings.impact: Users may not know they can use --verbose or --quiet to control output verbosity
findings.recommendation: Add --verbose/-v and --quiet/-q to the Global Options section

findings.title: Output format documentation incomplete
findings.description: The parent 'jira-as' command supports three output formats: text, json, and table. However, SKILL.md only documents 'text' and 'json' for the --output option. While subcommands may not support 'table' format, the parent-level documentation is incomplete.
findings.documented: --output, -o': Output format for `get` and `create` commands (text, json)
findings.impact: Minor - users may try 'table' format and get an error from subcommands
findings.recommendation: Clarify that issue commands support 'text' and 'json' formats only, even though the parent supports 'table'

findings.title: Update command missing explicit list of available fields
findings.description: The SKILL.md shows update examples but does not explicitly list all available fields for the update command in a reference table. While examples cover the main use cases, a complete field reference would be helpful.
findings.impact: Users may not discover all available update options
findings.recommendation: Add a reference table listing all update-available fields

overall_assessment: The jira-issue SKILL.md documentation is well-maintained and largely accurate. All four primary commands (create, get, update, delete) are correctly documented with accurate option lists and practical examples. The minor issues identified are related to incomplete documentation of global parent-command options (--verbose, --quiet) and lack of clarity that the parent command supports additional output formats beyond those available to issue subcommands.

examples_checked.example: jira-as issue create --project PROJ --type Bug --summary 'Login fails on mobile'
jira-as issue create --project PROJ --type Bug --summary 'Login fails on mobile' --description 'Users report 500 error when logging in from mobile browsers. See attached screenshot.'
jira-as issue update PROJ-123 --priority Critical --assignee self

recommendations.action: Add documentation for parent-level --verbose/-v and --quiet/-q options in the Global Options section
Clarify that 'table' output format is available at the parent jira-as level but not for issue subcommands
Add a reference table of update command field options for quick lookup
